comments.body: If you go to optimize world and click the erase data and cache box it seems to fix any lighting bugs.

How does one go about this if I use a server I manage myself? Where is this optimize button? Seems hard to find. I needed to use Amulet editor and all the time it produces lighting glitches! I can only get the dark to go away for the most part applying blocks of lanterns but this is getting tedious!

Get a pc. It's better than an Xbox. You are basically free to do whatever you can think of. They aren't locked down like consoles are. You don't have to pay money to buy Xbox gold or whatever it is just to connect to whatever server you want that should normally be free.

Seconding this. I mostly play in Creative and would love to turn off the recipe book so I don't constantly get "New Recipes Unlocked!" popping up when I pull out a block I haven't used before.

Heck, having the book off by default in Creative Mode would be nice.
That that showed put on the recipes  on
They replaced the clear hotbar button with the select recipe button and now I can't clear my hotbar

The spot for it is inconvenient too. I'll accidently click on it while moving items or my mouse. Its very annoying in a small window because sometimes it will just take up the whole screen and you cant click the book again because it blocks the inventory. Why can't it just be moved somewhere else?
In addition to this, Minecraft can make money off of purchasable title screens.
What do you want the title screens to sell for?

The idea is more than obvious that it must be included in the game, since of course in the case of the bedrock edition each player can create their own title screen and upload it to their market. And the screens "free" are from the previous versions.
Personally, I would prefer that they all be free, but I think a reasonable price would be a ten-pack for a dollar.

There really needs to be a report players button. Like I have came across 2 hackers in my last two games online and I could do nothing about it, please add a report button it would make online minecraft much more fun

Moved to proper category: User Interface, Input Methods and Menu Options

Like a "read only" feature. Where you can load the map "normally" in creative/survival/whatever.... but when you want to "GO WRECK IT!" you can load it up on "Read only" mode... that doesn't actually "save" anything...? 
If I get what you're saying, this isn't a half bad idea. I literally have multiple Test Worlds, and a backup folder, and even got a customizable backup-program specifically for things like this...  Sometimes I want to test a small change in a survival world, I either have to load a test world and "fake it" or copy my world, try it, then delete the copy.

I don't see, entirely, how much of a hassle, or priority this would be for programming. But I like the idea none-the-less

I really would like to see the paper doll and coordinates switched, so the coordinates are always in the most top left, as you mentioned.

Ditto switching coordinates and paper doll positions. When paper doll is enabled, the coordinates stretch into the middle of the screen, obscuring stuff you need to see even when no paper doll is shown. If they were switched, both would be on the periphery and nothing would be obscured.
i love this is like java❤️
Please Mojang add this

I would agree this is a necessary edition. it would also be funny and charming if swapping to left hand in settings is how you put an item in the left hand of armor stands, making that option available for vanilla survival builds and stuff.

BEGGING for this to be added! On YouTube, I saw a lotta other fellas who were wondering why they didn't have this setting on Bedrock, along with others who wished that it were possible.. Secondly, it'd be cool if other players could see your character primarily using their left hand instead of it just being client-sided! And it's always lame when features are only available for specific versions considering that it's the same game. As much as it doesn't matter, it'd be awesome if it were added!
This is such a good idea!

Its not only pvp-wise but, also while building .Looking around with such a low sens is painful, and having a  deadzone would  allow me of either building without my character moving by it self, or picking items without me havin to fight my controller just to type "Hi" .Please this isn't a "good idea" its necessary to implement it in the game.
Ive seen so many suggestions about this feature. Can we please just dedicate one week to build this feature to improve all controller players gaming experience
no.
Hope Mojang You can see. This idea is really great.

In bedrock edition there is a cape for just having the game (pancape). There should be also a free cape for everyone who bought or will buy the game in the future or the past with a Microsoft account.

I agree.

I started playing Minecraft in July 2021, with a Microsoft account even though I wanted to be able to make a Mojang one but was no longer able to.

Then a few months later, the Migration cape was announced. I wished I had an account I could migrate and receive the cape, but I was already in a Microsoft account.

Please if you implement this, don't forget about servers.

It would be cool if the client could send a packet every time they click on an advancement.

This would be a great feature for plugin developers especially. It would allow for you to do create so many cool in-game features. Even if it's not used in vanilla, it would still be nice to have the ability to track clicks.
is a good idea
Very Good IDea
That is a pretty cool idea. Would speed up things a lot, specially for axe, shovel and hoe, not everything is kept in hotbar.
I always thought this will be a pretty good idea. I hope this is someday actually released in the game.

The best part about this idea is how much more space will be available on the hotbar. Most players already have a majority of their space taken up by tools, weapons, shields, torches, food, totems, etc, and there's hardly any room for blocks when you're building. Having all of the basic tools relegated to one hotbar slot gives more room for blocks and decorations that the player might want to place.

I love this idea, another way of implementing it would be if you already have the block that you are looking at in your hand and you middle click then it gives you the tool and just middle clicking on a hostile mob gives you your sword. Also, if you do it on a sheep it could give you shears, on a cow you get a bucket, and other special tools for passive mobs.
Yes, Please We Neeed This
Bring back the Wide Smile for Minecraft Bedrock Edition
I think a dev once said they wanted to have new video settings that assist those with seeing difficult (i.e colorblindness). I think they'd add this if more players would draw attention to it.

Ah, yes, the wibbly wobbly effects. I don't think the loading screen should be instant, however, as someone may go through the portal while not wanting to cross worlds. Perhaps a fade in or something?
When is Nether Update???
It makes me so nauseous. And I don't even have any sort of issues like that.
Hey! A little late, but if you can install OptiFine, go into the Quality tab under Video Settings, and you can turn down the distortion effects to 0%, and the portal nausea effect is gone! :)
